qas.question: What do religions communities have to register with?

answers.text: State Committee on Religious Affairs (SCRA) and with local authorities
a charter, a list of 10 or more members, and evidence of local government approval prayer site location

qas.question: What do you have to have to gather for public prayer?
What can happen if you do not register?

answers.text: can result in large fines and closure of place of worship

qas.question: Religious groups that have a physical structure are not allowed to do what?
Failure to do what results in small fines?
People under the age of 16 are barred from what?

plausible_answers.text: a charter, a list of 10 or more members, and evidence of local government approval prayer site location

qas.question: Registration with the ASPCA requires what?

context: By law, religious communities must register by the <a0_0>State Committee on Religious Affairs (SCRA) and with local authorities<a0_0/>. Registration with the SCRA requires <a1_0><b7_0>a charter, a list of 10 or more members, and evidence of local government approval prayer site location<b7_0/><a1_0/>. Religious groups who do not have <a2_0>a physical structure<a2_0/> are not allowed to <b4_0>gather publicly for prayer<b4_0/>. Failure to <b5_0>register<b5_0/> <a3_0>can result in large fines and closure of place of worship<a3_0/>. There are reports that registration on the local level is sometimes difficult to obtain. People under the age of 18 are also barred from <b6_0>public religious practice<b6_0/>.
